title: Color Fundamentals
description: Learn the basics of color, color models, and color properties

intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: Understanding color fundamentals is the foundation for working with design. Colors can be classified by various characteristics: by model, temperature, and properties.

models.title: Color Models
models.content: There are different color models, each used for different purposes:

rgb.title: RGB (Red, Green, Blue)
rgb.desc: Additive model for screens and digital devices. Used in web design and digital graphics.

cmyk.title: CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Key)
cmyk.desc: Subtractive model for printing. Used in printing and print design.

wheel.title: Color Wheel
wheel.content: The color wheel is a tool for understanding relationships between colors. Primary colors (red, blue, yellow) are evenly spaced around the circle, with secondary and tertiary colors between them.

temperature.title: Color Temperature
temperature.content: Colors are divided into warm and cool based on their visual perception:

warm.title: Warm Colors
warm.desc: Red, orange, yellow — create a sense of warmth, energy, and activity.

cool.title: Cool Colors
cool.desc: Blue, green, purple — create a sense of coolness, calm, and stability.

properties.title: Color Properties
properties.content: Each color has three main properties:

items.0: Hue — the color itself (red, blue, etc.)
items.1: Saturation — the intensity of the color
items.2: Brightness/Lightness — the lightness or darkness of the color
